sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"奇迹"之意。
means: marvel ： 侧重异乎寻常，奇怪，从而使人好奇。
miracle ： 一般指被认为是人力所办不到的奇异之事。
wonder ： 通常指使人惊奇的事迹、人物或景观，主要指人创造的奇迹。
phenomenon ： 指罕见的现象或奇人、奇事。

sentence.Network_en: I wonder if I might have a word with Mr Abbot?
sentence.Network_cn: 请问我能否和阿博特先生说几句话？

sentence.Network_en: Some supernova researchers wondered if it might be just a nine-day wonder.
sentence.Network_cn: 有些超新星研究者怀疑，这可能只是昙花一现。

sentence.Network_en: Did you ever wonder how the top supermodels manage to look stunning?
sentence.Network_cn: 难道你就没有想过那些超级名模是如何做到外表如此惊艳的吗?

jx.jx_cn_mean: 并不奇怪；不足为奇；十分正常

lj.lj_ly: &B{it is little wonder that} the fax machine is so popular.
lj.lj_ls: 传真机如此受欢迎并不奇怪。

jx.jx_en_mean: something that attracts enthusiastic interest for a short while but is then ignored or forgotten
jx.jx_cn_mean: 轰动一时的东西（但很快就会被忘记）

jx.jx_en_mean: an exclamation of great surprise at something pleasing
jx.jx_cn_mean: ［用于看到令人高兴的东西时发出的感叹］永远都有奇迹

jx.jx_en_mean: have a very beneficial effect on someone or something
jx.jx_cn_mean: 创奇迹；产生奇妙的作用

lj.lj_ly: a good night's sleep can work wonders for mind and body.
lj.lj_ls: 一夜好眠对身心都能产生奇妙的作用。

jx.jx_en_mean: As a cause for surprise; surprisingly.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 作为惊奇的原因；惊奇地

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English wundor (noun), wundrian (verb), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch wonder and German Wunder, of unknown ultimate origin

entry.tran: 感到疑惑;纳闷儿;想弄明白
entry.def: If you wonder about something, you think about it, either because it interests you and you want to know more about it, or because you are worried or suspicious about it.

example.ex: I wondered what that noise was...
example.tran: 我纳闷儿那是什么声音。

example.ex: 'He claims to be her father,' said Max. 'We've been wondering about him.'...
example.tran: “他自称是她父亲，”马克斯说，“我们一直都在怀疑他。”

entry.def: If you wonder at something, you are very surprised about it or think about it in a very surprised way.

example.ex: He liked to sit and wonder at all that had happened...
example.tran: 他喜欢坐着对发生的一切惊叹不已。

example.ex: Walk down Castle Street, admire our little jewel of a cathedral, then wonder at the castle...
example.tran: 沿着城堡街走下去，欣赏我们视若珍宝的教堂，继而叹服于城堡的壮观。

entry.def: If you say that it is a wonder that something happened, you mean that it is very surprising and unexpected.

example.ex: It's a wonder that it took almost ten years...
example.tran: 这差不多用了10年的时间，真是桩奇事。

example.ex: The wonder is that Olivier was not seriously hurt.
example.tran: 奥利维尔伤得不重，真是奇迹。

entry.def: Wonder is a feeling of great surprise and pleasure that you have, for example when you see something that is very beautiful, or when something happens that you thought was impossible.

example.ex: 'That's right!' Bobby exclaimed in wonder. 'How did you remember that?'...
example.tran: “对呀！”博比惊奇地叫道。“你是怎么想起那件事的？”

example.ex: I was expressing some amazement and wonder at her good fortune...
example.tran: 我对她的好运既惊奇又感叹。

entry.def: A wonder is something that causes people to feel great surprise or admiration.

example.ex: ...a lecture on the wonders of space and space exploration.
example.tran: 关于宇宙奇观和太空探险的讲座

example.ex: ...the wonder of seeing his name in print...
example.tran: 看见他的名字出现在出版物上的诧异

entry.tran: 神奇的;奇妙的;有奇效的
entry.def: If you refer, for example, to a young man as a wonder boy, or to a new product as a wonder drug, you mean that they are believed by many people to be very good or very effective.

example.ex: Mickelson was hailed as the wonder boy of American golf...
example.tran: 米克尔森被誉为美国高尔夫球界的神奇小子。

example.ex: Dr Williams describes it as a potential wonder drug.
example.tran: 威廉斯医生称其可能会成为特效药。

entry.tran: 昙花一现的人(或事物);惊艳一时的人(或事物)
entry.def: If you say that someone or something is a nine-day wonder or a one-day wonder, you disapprove of the fact that they are attracting so much interest and attention, because you think that their popularity will only last for a very short time.

example.ex: Harry dismissed his old friend's speech as 'a nine-day wonder'...
example.tran: 哈里对老朋友的讲话不屑一顾，称之“火不了多久”。

example.ex: Some supernova researchers wondered if it might be just a nine-day wonder.
example.tran: 有些超新星研究者怀疑，这可能只是昙花一现。

entry.tran: (用于礼貌地请人做事、征求意见或打听消息时)不知…，请问…
entry.def: You can say 'I wonder' if you want to be very polite when you are asking someone to do something, or when you are asking them for their opinion or for information.

example.ex: I was just wondering if you could help me...
example.tran: 不知您是否能帮我个忙。

example.ex: I just wonder what you make of all that...
example.tran: 我只是纳闷儿你是怎么看待这一切的。

entry.def: If you say 'no wonder', 'little wonder', or 'small wonder', you mean that something is not surprising.

example.ex: No wonder my brother wasn't feeling well...
example.tran: 难怪我兄弟感觉不舒服了。

example.ex: Under such circumstances, it is little wonder that they experience difficulties...
example.tran: 在这种情形下，他们遇到困难就不足为怪了。

entry.tran: （表示找出某事的原因）难怪，怪不得
entry.def: You can say 'No wonder' when you find out the reason for something that has been puzzling you for some time.

example.ex: Brad was Jane's brother! No wonder he reminded me so much of her!
example.tran: 布拉德是简的兄弟！怪不得他老是让我想起她呢！

entry.def: If you say that a person or thing works wonders or does wonders, you mean that they have a very good effect on something.

example.ex: A few moments of relaxation can work wonders...
example.tran: 放松一会儿就可以收到奇效。

example.ex: Rushton has done wonders for the industry.
example.tran: 拉什顿创造了行业奇迹。

means.word_mean: 1. the feeling aroused by something strange and surprising
2. something that causes feelings of wonder;
3. a state in which you want to learn more about something
1. have a wish or desire to know something;

sentences.sentence: "He wondered who had built this beautiful church"

means.word_mean: 2. place in doubt or express doubtful speculation;

sentences.sentence: "I wonder whether this was the right thing to do"
"she wondered whether it would snow tonight"
"We marvelled at the child's linguistic abilities"

auth_sentence.content: No wonder he is searching for work in Luxembourg.
auth_sentence.res_content: No wonder he is searching for work in Luxembourg.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: No wonder he is searching for work in Luxembourg.

auth_sentence.content: Wonder what they've got planned for this afternoon?
auth_sentence.res_content: Wonder what they've got planned for this afternoon?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Wonder what they've got planned for this afternoon?

auth_sentence.content: So I wonder what sources they are drawing on.
auth_sentence.res_content: So I wonder what sources they are drawing on.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: So I wonder what sources they are drawing on.

Sentence.sentence: Yes, I wonder when I'll be informed about my application for the job.
When I look at my friendship with Joe, I wonder how many people I've known whom I never disliked, but simply didn't take the time to get to know.
But I wonder how he could get a job when he looks like that.
I wonder what they are protesting against.
I wonder if you could say then in a few words what the advantages are for a girl at a single-sex school
We are, supposedly, creating a technological wonder world.

sentences.en: Jacelin says he didn't do it, but I still wonder.
sentences.cn: 杰斯林说他没那样做, 可我仍然怀疑。

sentences.en: They waited and wondered what to do.
sentences.cn: 他们等待着, 不知干什么。

sentences.en: I wonder none of you were hurt.
sentences.cn: 我纳闷怎么你们谁也没受伤。

sentences.en: I wonder how you came to miss your way.
sentences.cn: 我想知道你是怎样迷路的。

means.word_mean: 惊奇, 惊叹, 惊异, 惊诧

sentences.en: He felt wonder mingled with awe at the Grand Canyon.
sentences.cn: 面对着大峡谷, 他又惊奇又敬畏。

sentences.en: He's a wonder with the way he arranges everything without any help.
sentences.cn: 他不要任何帮忙就把事情样样办妥, 真是个奇才。

means.word_mean: 奇观, 奇景, 奇迹, 奇事

sentences.en: Books are filled with many wonders.
sentences.cn: 书中充满了新奇的事物。

means.word_mean: 对…感到好奇；对…感到惊讶；急欲知道

sentences.cn: 他想知道发生了什么事。

sentences.en: I wonder at your allowing her to buy the expensive clothes.
sentences.cn: 我对你答应她买这么贵的衣服感到吃惊。

jushi.english: Jacqueline says she didn't do it, but I still wonder.
jushi.chinese: 杰奎琳说她没那样做,可我仍然怀疑。

jushi.english: I wonder to see him looking so cheerful.
jushi.chinese: 我很惊讶地发现他如此高兴。
